intro: Tithymalus epithymoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
